page.description: Get the calendar week number of a date where Sunday is the first day of the week.
page.prototype: Week_Number as N = week(Date_Value as D)

argument.name: Date_Value
argument.description: The date used to determine the calendar week of the year.

return.name: Week_Number
return.description: Returns an integer equal to the week number (1-53) for the specified *[xb:Date_Value]*.

page.discussion: The *[xb:WEEK()]* function returns the integer equal to the week number (1-53) for the specified *[xb:Date_Value]*. Every week starts on Sunday. A week includes any number of days in the year. For example, if January 1 is on a Saturday, it is in week 1. January 2 (a Sunday) would be in week 2.
